Issues.Title: WFAC010 build warning directly contradicts WPF guidance (WPF and WinForms can be used together)
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

6.0

### Issue description

No issue template seems well-placed to receive feedback on build-time analyzers.

This warning appears when you use Windows Forms in a WPF application:

> WFAC010 Remove high DPI settings from app.manifest and configure via Application.SetHighDpiMode API or 'ApplicationHighDpiMode' project property

However, WPF guidance instructs you to place these settings in app.manifest:
https://github.com/microsoft/WPF-Samples/blob/main/PerMonitorDPI/readme.md#enabling-per-monitor-dpi-for-your-app

Given that this is a WPF app which only uses Windows Forms in order to make use of FolderBrowserDialog, calling System.Windows.Forms.Application.SetHighDpiMode during WPF app startup seems inappropriate.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WPF app
2. Follow the WPF per-monitor DPI instructions at https://github.com/microsoft/WPF-Samples/blob/main/PerMonitorDPI/readme.md#enabling-per-monitor-dpi-for-your-app
3. Add `<UseWindowsForms>true</UseWindowsForms>`
4. Build and see the warning
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WFAC010 build warning directly contradicts WPF guidance (WPF and WinForms can be used together)" (#7432)

Issues.Title: Workaround for empty finalizer in ApplicationContext.
Issues.Body:
Contribute to https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6858.
This is continuation of https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/6878 based on discussion.
Documentation for calling `GC.SuppressFinalize` on users subclasses also need to be updated some how...

The benefit of this change is not obvious like with `DataGridView`. The one I see is that `ModalApplicationContext` is never disposed after `ShowDialog` call, so it's ending up in Freachable queue.

## Test methodology
Existing UT.
New UT for all subclasses coverage.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7431)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Workaround for empty finalizer in ApplicationContext." (#7431)

Issues.Title: Using the CsWin32 PInvoke library
Issues.Body:
Converted these threads:
-GetCurrentProcessId
-GlobalAlloc
-GlobalReAlloc
-GlobalLock
-GlobalUnlock
-GlobalFree

Deleted FreeLibrery.cs since it wasn't being used anywhere in teh method and only refered to itself.

Fixed the information messages in:
-Application.cs
-NativeWindow.cs
-ControlDesigner.cs

Issues.Title: Scenario where DesignMode is false from the NET WinForms OOP designer
Issues.Body:
### Description

When using my NET6 Windows Forms custom control to display a dialog at design time, the DesignMode value is incorrectly false even though it is running in the DesignToolsServer process.

### Reproduction Steps

My github sample to reproduce:
https://github.com/tracktownsoftware/MicrosoftWinFormsDesignerSDK_DesignModeBug

The above repository includes a Nuget package you can use to test and reproduce. The nuget package contains a custom NET6 WinForms "MyButton" control with WinForms Designer Extensibility SDK design-time support.

### Expected behavior

DesignMode should be true because it is running in the DesignToolsServer process.

### Actual behavior

DesignMode is false.

See https://github.com/tracktownsoftware/MicrosoftWinFormsDesignerSDK_DesignModeBug/blob/main/README.md

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

Rather than using DesignMode check for System.Diagnostics.Process.GetCurrentProcess().ProcessName=="DesignToolsServer"

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Scenario where DesignMode is false from the NET WinForms OOP designer" (#7424)

Fixes #2907


## Proposed changes

- Added new  UIAutomation PropertyId IsDialogPropertyId.
- Set IsDialogPropertyId in FormAccessibleObject.GetPropertyValue(UiaCore.UIA propertyID)

Issues.Title: TabPage class and it's accessible object are leaking in memory
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET Version: 7.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

TabPage and it's accessible object are left in memory after the ToolStrip control instance was selected with Narrator and the form with ToolStrip is closed, garbage is collected, but Narrator is still opened.

### Steps to reproduce

Create a parent form with two buttons: one will be opening a child form with the TabPage control and the other will collect the garbage.
Press the second button to open the child form with TabPage.
Start the Narrator.
Select the TabPage components using the Narrator.
Close the child form.
Clear memory with the first button of the parent form.
DON'T close the Narrator.
Look for TabPage accessible objects left in memory (using WinDbg, or dotMemory, or another suitable tool).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TabPage class and it's accessible object are leaking in memory" (#7415)

Issues.Title: Fixing incorrect selection of ListViewGroup for ListView.GroupCollapsedStateChanged event (#6708)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #6708

## Proposed changes

- Processed all unique groups of selected items through collapse. The collapse state had been validated in cycle and correct group(s) triggered for GroupCollapsedStateChanged.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- ListView.GroupCollapsedStateChanged event works correctly in case of multiple groups selection.

Issues.Title: Returning the AccessibilityObject of a DataGridViewRowHeaderCell instead of a DataGrid...
Issues.Body:
â€¦ViewRow for display bounds correctly.


<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #6570


## Proposed changes

- Return the AccessibilityObject of a DataGridViewRowHeaderCell instead of a DataGridViewRow when the user hovers over a DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.
- Remove redundant 'else'.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Border of DataGridViewRowHeaderCell draws correctly in Inspect or AI.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/109065597/178901949-4a034237-2f96-42f9-bbbd-f44dd75cc9a2.png)


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually tested the change in a winforms app

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

- Using AI, Inspect

Issues.Title: Make the TreeView respect the DoubleBuffered property
Issues.Body:
Fixes #4883

## Proposed changes

- The TreeView will respect the DoubleBuffered property.

## Customer Impact

- Double buffering can be enabled in a derived class without needing to use P/Invoke.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

Probably minimal.

## Test methodology 

- Manually tested the change in a winforms app

## Test environment(s) 

- 7.0.100-preview.5.22307.18 (x64)
